results.title: The Joker to the thief
results.brief_description: A surreal hand-drawn computer animation of a thief who steals his way into a mediaeval castle. Filled with hallucenogenic imagery the thief is surrounded by magic, scenes of madness and other horrors. He attempts to flee but is followed by the joker equipped with his tricks.

results.title: Flare
results.brief_description: Using a mixture of 2D computer animation styles influenced my Manga films, Flare is surreal with images of insects seen through the microscrope, metaphorically illustrating the obsessions and world of a dedicated scientist. The scientist is confronted by his daughter who insists he talk with her about family issues of the past. The father ignores his daughters request and chooses to bury himself in his work.

results.title: La Maison des Cochons
results.creator_credit: David Harris, Matt Tumbers and Minty
results.brief_description: A claymation about an unsuspecting man whose fondness for baby pork is tantalised when he passes a restaurant that specialises in pig dishes. He is charmed and impressed by the service and ambience of the restaurant as he places his order with the waiter. The gruesome truth of the restaurant is soon revealed to the man when his dish arrives.

results.title: Deeth treo
results.brief_description: A surreal cut-out animation of a lone horse seen travelling the desert with a mortally wounded knight strapped to his back. The horse in collusion with the tree delivers the corpse to sate the tree’s canabalistic desires. A black comedy.

results.title: Essence of Terror
results.brief_description: An inquisitive young boy explores the contents of the medicine cabinet and is tempted into trying the jar labelled ‘Adol Essence’… He is plunged into a world of terror as his body starts to change in alarming new ways.

results.title: Washing machine circa 1522
results.brief_description: A hand-drawn animation on paper in sepia tone in response to the theme washing machine and metamorphosis. Martin Luther (1483-1546) is a monk but also religious reformer and inventor. As he is working hard on an invention when he is attacked by a ‘Japanese’ insect. The affected monk slips into various states of metamorphosis whilst wrestling with inventing the washing machine. A tool of the Devil.

results.title: World #37...previsited
results.brief_description: World #37…previsited is a 3D computer animation (created on 3D Studio 4) of a futuristic city run by warring armed robotic soldiers. The film initially navigates the viewer through the city absent of people to focus on the only visible inhabitants being the robotic soldiers who begin to march to war. The 3D Cafe (Platinum Pictures) made the original models for the mountains, trees, the colossal statue, dragon gargoyles and robot’s skirts and boots.

results.title: Maya
results.brief_description: Maya is a non-narrative collage of various 2D computer animation styles and images. The layered and merging images are created by a number of methods employing various styles from pixilated hand-drawn images to photographically sourced images of ancient and contemporary Thai culture.

results.title: The Pyre of Triune
results.brief_description:
A paint-on-glass animation exploring personal themes of spirituality - representing a journey into the soul and the discovery of the spirit of god, a struggle for meaning and the light within.
Created as part of coursework at the Centre for Animation and Interactive Media (AIM), RMIT, 1997.
